title: Dracula: Pages from a Virgin's Diary
creator_credit: Deanne Rohde, Paul Daigle and CBC
brief_description: A cinematic version of the Royal Winnipeg Ballet’s adaptation of Bram Stoker’s Gothic novel Dracula, filmed in a style reminiscent of silent Expressionist cinema of the early 20th century, complete with inter-titles and monochrome photography.

constellations_other.name: Using the silent film aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Explore how contemporary filmmakers use visual references to the silent era to convey information to a film literate audience.

description: A cinematic version of the Royal Winnipeg Ballet’s adaptation of Bram Stoker’s gothic novel Dracula. Filmed in a style reminiscent of silent Expressionist cinema of the early 20th century (complete with intertitles and monochrome photography), it uses dance to tell the story of a sinister but intriguing immigrant who preys upon young English women.
description_for_label: A cinematic version of the Royal Winnipeg Ballet’s adaptation of Bram Stoker’s gothic novel Dracula. Filmed in a style reminiscent of silent Expressionist cinema of the early 20th century (complete with intertitles and monochrome photography), it uses dance to tell the story of a sinister but intriguing immigrant who preys upon young English women.
